articles.author: Jack Kim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Tuesday declared martial law in an unannounced late night address broadcast live on YTN television, claiming he would eradicate "shameless pro-North Korean anti-state forces".
articles.title: South Korea President Yoon declares martial law

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Top Lebanese officials have urged Washington and Paris to press Israel to uphold a ceasefire, after dozens of military operations on Lebanese soil that Beirut has deemed violations, two senior Lebanese political sources told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Lebanon asked U.S., France to press Israel to halt truce breaches, say sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 12 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Tuesday, most of them in the town of Beit Lahiya on the northern edge, medics said, as the army issued new evacuation orders in the south of the tiny enclave.
articles.title: Israel issues new evacuation orders in Gaza, kills 12 people

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Russian presidential aircraft and funds were used in a program that took children from occupied Ukrainian territories, stripped them of Ukrainian identity and placed them with Russian families, according to a report by Yale's School of Public Health.
articles.title: Putin-controlled aircraft deported Ukrainian children, U.S.-backed research alleges

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli leaders hailed on Tuesday a pledge by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump that there would be "hell to pay" in the Middle East unless hostages held in the Gaza Strip were released ahead of his Jan. 20 inauguration.
articles.title: Israeli leaders applaud Trump pledge on hostages, Gazans fear the worse

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Romania's hard-right Alliance for Uniting Romanians (AUR) party wants to be part of a coalition government, its leader said on Tuesday, as the nation eyes a presidential run-off vote that will decide who appoints the prime minister.
articles.title: Romanian hard right says it wants to be part of new government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France is at a turning point due to uncertainty over the country's budget and the future of the government, Finance Minister Antoine Armand said on Tuesday.
articles.title: France at turning point amid budget uncertainty, finance minister says

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Every day, Nidia Montenegro spends hours checking her cellphone, hoping to receive a long-awaited appointment with U.S. border officials to seek asylum in the United States.
articles.title: Scared to stay in Mexico, afraid of Trump's policies, some migrants look to return home

articles.author: Anne Kauranen, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The 12-day 'Freezing Winds' drill was part of a push to step up the transatlantic defence alliance's protection of infrastructure in waters that carry 15% of global shipping traffic and are seen as increasingly vulnerable to attack.
articles.title: As sabotage allegations swirl, NATO struggles to secure the Baltic Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraq will not act as a mere spectator in Syria where it believes groups and sects are victims of ethnic cleansing, Iraq's prime minister said on Tuesday, according to a readout from his office of a phone call to Turkey's president.
articles.title: Iraq will not be just a 'spectator' in Syria, prime minister says
